**The Echogrump**

Beware the Echogrump, my child!
The voice that ribbons, multiplies,
In underpasses dark and riled,
Where soundish ghostlings tell their lies.

Take up your mufflephones so tight,
Your silencizer sharp and true,
For when the twilight blenders night,
The Echogrump comes hunting you.

He went with whisperaxe in hand,
Through tunnel-tubes where drip-drops fell,
The walls were slickish, ceiling-spanned,
And every footstep rang a bell.

Then BOOM-BA-LOOM! The creature spoke,
Its voice came bouncing, splitting, spreading,
Each syllable the tunnel broke
To thousand-sounds of sonic shredding.

One, two! One, two! His blade went through
The whiffle-waffle-wailing beast,
The echos died to nothing new,
The tunnel's torment finally ceased.

He trudged back through the quiet way,
The underpass now safe and still,
"You've slain the Echogrump today!"
They cheered from houses on the hill.

So shun the Echogrump, my dear,
That voice-beast dwelling down below,
In underpasses dank with fear,
Where soundish ghostlings come and go.

With compasslines a-whirling, scribbly-scrawled.

Beware the beast that paper-paths enthralled!

The meridians that munch, the scales that bite!  
Shun chartish woods where latitudes entware,  
And gridlines gleam with phosphorescent fright!"

His protractors a-jingle at his side.  
Through folded peaks and legend-symbol land,  
Where North-stars weep and compasspoints divide.

The Mapperslatch came whiffling, eyes aflame!  
Its tentaroads went writhing, mad to quell  
The boy who dared to navigate its game!

Snick-snack! His ruler sliced through paper-hide,

The beast fell flat—no longer magnified—  
Just ink and parchment crumpled on the ground.

"You've slain the Mapperslatch!" they cried with glee,

They danced the joyous jig of longitude-free,  
While cartofolds flapped gently in the sky.

Beware the PowerPointed one,
